name: servicenow-create-table-record
description: Inserts one record in the specified table.

table_name.description: The name of the table where the record will be created.

table_record.description: The table record object. Use name-value pairs for each field of the record.

api_version.description: API version number. Version numbers identify the endpoint version that a URI accesses. By specifying a version number in your URIs, you can ensure that future updates to the REST API do not negatively impact your integration. Use `lastest` to use the latest REST endpoint for your instance version.

x_no_response_body.description: By default, responses include body content detailing the modified record. Set this request header to true to suppress the response body.

sysparm_display_value.description: Return field display values (true), actual values (false), or both (all) (default: false).

sysparm_exclude_reference_link.description:
Flag that indicates whether to exclude Table API links for reference fields.
* `true`: Exclude Table API links for reference fields.
* `false`: Include Table API links for reference fields.

sysparm_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return in the response.

sysparm_input_display_value.description:
Flag that indicates whether to set field values using the display value or the actual value.
* `true`: Treats input values as display values and they are manipulated so they can be stored properly in the database.
* `false`: Treats input values as actual values and stored them in the database without manipulation.

sysparm_view.description: Render the response according to the specified UI view (overridden by sysparm_fields).

name: servicenow-get-table-record-by-sysid
description: Retrieves the record identified by the specified sys_id from the specified table.

table_name.description: The name of the table containing the record to retrieve.

sys_id.description: Unique identifier of the record to retrieve.

api_version.description: API version number. Version numbers identify the endpoint version that a URI accesses. By specifying a version number in your URIs, you can ensure that future updates to the REST API do not negatively impact your integration. Use `lastest` to use the latest REST endpoint for your instance version.

sysparm_display_value.description: Return field display values (true), actual values (false), or both (all) (default: false).

sysparm_exclude_reference_link.description: True to exclude Table API links for reference fields (default: false).

sysparm_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return in the response.

sysparm_view.description: Render the response according to the specified UI view (overridden by sysparm_fields).

sysparm_query_no_domain.description: True to access data across domains if authorized (default: false).

name: servicenow-get-table-records
description: Retrieves multiple records for the specified table.

table_name.description: The name of the table containing the records to retrieve.

api_version.description: API version number. Version numbers identify the endpoint version that a URI accesses. By specifying a version number in your URIs, you can ensure that future updates to the REST API do not negatively impact your integration. Use `lastest` to use the latest REST endpoint for your instance version.

sysparm_display_value.description: Return field display values (true), actual values (false), or both (all) (default: false).

sysparm_exclude_reference_link.description: True to exclude Table API links for reference fields (default: false).

sysparm_suppress_pagination_header.description: True to supress pagination header (default: false).

sysparm_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return in the response.

sysparm_limit.description: The maximum number of results returned per page (default: 10,000).

sysparm_view.description: Render the response according to the specified UI view (overridden by sysparm_fields).

sysparm_query_category.description: Name of the query category (read replica category) to use for queries.

sysparm_query_no_domain.description: True to access data across domains if authorized (default: false).

sysparm_no_count.description: Do not execute a select count(*) on table (default: false).

name: servicenow-update-table-record
description: Updates the specified record with the name-value pairs included in the request body.

table_name.description: The name of the table containing the record to update.

sys_id.description: Unique identifier of the record to update.

update_fields.description:
An object with name-value pairs with the fields to update in the specified record.
**Note:** All fields within a record may not be available for update. For example, fields that have a prefix of "sys_" are typically system parameters that are automatically generated and cannot be updated.

api_version.description: API version number. Version numbers identify the endpoint version that a URI accesses. By specifying a version number in your URIs, you can ensure that future updates to the REST API do not negatively impact your integration. Use `lastest` to use the latest REST endpoint for your instance version.

x_no_response_body.description: By default, responses include body content detailing the modified record. Set this request header to true to suppress the response body.

sysparm_display_value.description: Return field display values (true), actual values (false), or both (all) (default: false).

sysparm_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return in the response.

sysparm_input_display_value.description:
Flag that indicates whether to set field values using the display value or the actual value.
* `true`: Treats input values as display values and they are manipulated so they can be stored properly in the database.
* `false`: Treats input values as actual values and stored them in the database without manipulation.

sysparm_view.description: Render the response according to the specified UI view (overridden by sysparm_fields).

sysparm_query_no_domain.description: True to access data across domains if authorized (default: false).
